intro: Verbascum rotundifolium subsp. rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leaf mullein, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety, gray-green leaves that are rounded in shape. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in clusters at the top of the stem, which bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
